name: Azalai
desc: A grocery store owner in Aaru Village.

customize.text: Adventure Challenge: A Competitor Most Bestial?

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
When merchants from different regions encounter each other, the sparks of creativity will invariably fly. For example, someone once said: "If one could tame a Fungus that had legs, could it help deliver goods and protect our caravans?" This idea was firmly burned into Azalai's mind, its presence unfading...
<color=#ffffffd9>Opposing Lineup</color>

customize.name: Lucky Coin
customize.desc: Currency verified and used by the Genius Invokation TCG Society. Can be used to purchase various items related to Genius Invokation TCG. It is said that these coins were initially named as such in the hopes that they would bring those carrying them luck. However, perhaps it is those who are sufficiently lucky who are able to possess them...

customize.name: Aaru Mixed Rice
customize.desc: A large serving of filling staple food. In this dish that combines rice, noodles, and beans together, the secret of great taste lies in the sweet and sour flavor imparted by tomatoes. Owing to its common nature and low price, this dish is a great choice for sating one's hunger â€” which is one of the key reasons why this recipe has spread from Aaru Village to the rest of Sumeru.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Candied Ajilenakh Nut
customize.desc: A rich dessert. First, the syrup is boiled till clear, then mixed with fillings and sesame paste from Sumeru. Then at last, the evenly-mixed syrup is poured into a mold and allowed to solidify into this crunchy form. It is said that the cold lands of Snezhnaya are a host to a similar dish, with a slightly different flavor profile. Of course, both sides naturally believe theirs to be the greatest in all Teyvat.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Spice
customize.desc: A seasoning with varied flavors. It is made from dried Harra Fruits and can enrich the taste of a dish. Therefore, Sumeru locals say, "Spice goes well with anything."

customize.desc: A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It is quite hardy indeed. Once it matures, the center of the cap will split open.

customize.name: Ajilenakh Nut
customize.desc: A fruit that grows on evergreen trees within desert oases. The flesh under the tough skin is thick, sweet, and delicious, making it an important food source amongst the desert peoples.
